documentation.text: @dev StakeRegistry contract
@dev SLARegistry contract
@dev (tokenAddress=>uint256) total pooled token balance
@dev (tokenAddress=>stakerAddress=>uint256) staker position to represent his proportion staked
@dev (tokenAddress=>uint256) used to keep track of the total stakes per token, to calculate proportion of compensation pool
@dev (tokenAddress=>uint256) users available compensation per token
@dev (periodId=>tokenAddress=>uint256) provider compensation per period and per token
@dev address[] of the stakers of the SLA contract
@dev DSLA token address to burn fees
@dev array with the allowed tokens addresses for the current SLA
@dev corresponds to the burn rate of DSLA tokens, but divided by 1000 i.e burn percentage = burnRate/1000 %
@dev minimum deposit for Tier 1 staking
@dev minimum deposit for Tier 2 staking
@dev minimum deposit for Tier 3 staking
@dev PeriodRegistry defined amount of periods over a year
@dev PeriodRegistry period type of the SLA contract
@dev length of the _periodIds array, to state effective APY
@dev boolean to declare if contract is whitelisted
@dev (userAddress=bool) to declare whitelisted addresses

attributes.text:
@dev use this function to evaluate the length of the allowed tokens length
@return allowedTokens.length

_claimCompensation(address).details: claim user compensation. Transfers both the compensation and the user remaining stake.

params._tokenAddress: 1. address of the token to claim compensation

addAllowedTokens(address).details: add a token to ve allowed for staking

params._tokenAddress: 1. address of the new allowed token

params._slaPeriodsLength: 4. length of the SLA periodsId stored on the sla contract

getAllowedTokensLength().details: use this function to evaluate the length of the allowed tokens length

getStakeholdersPositions(address).details: gets the positions of stake both for provider and for users

params._tokenAddress: 1. token address to get the positions

returns.providerStake: position of the provider (owner) of the SLA contract
returns.usersStake: position of the user of the SLA contract

isAllowedToken(address).details: checks in the allowedTokens array if there's a token with _tokenAddress value

returns._0: true if _tokenAddress exists in the allowedTokens array

isStaker(address).details: returns true if the _staker address is registered as staker

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

DSLAburnRate.details: corresponds to the burn rate of DSLA tokens, but divided by 1000 i.e burn percentage = burnRate/1000 %

allowedTokens.details: array with the allowed tokens addresses for the current SLA

dslaTokenAddress.details: DSLA token address to burn fees

periodType.details: PeriodRegistry period type of the SLA contract

providerPeriodsRewards.details: (periodId=>tokenAddress=>uint256) provider compensation per period and per token

slaPeriodsLength.details: length of the _periodIds array, to state effective APY

stakeHoldersPositions.details: (tokenAddress=>stakerAddress=>uint256) staker position to represent his proportion staked

stakers.details: address[] of the stakers of the SLA contract

usersStakeRecord.details: (tokenAddress=>uint256) used to keep track of the total stakes per token, to calculate proportion of compensation pool

whitelisted.details: boolean to declare if contract is whitelisted

yearlyPeriods.details: PeriodRegistry defined amount of periods over a year

_claimCompensation(address).notice: it uses the user position and the user total position per token to check the proportion of the compensation pool that corresponds to every user
